name: Mermaid Crossing
description:
Mermaid Crossing offers two houses for the price of one! The main house offers two bedrooms, and the detached master suite offers a king size bed that may be split into two twins upon request. Ocean views from every room! Serene and private setting.

The space
Mermaid Crossing offers two houses for the price of one! The main house offers two bedrooms with queen size beds in each room, and the detached master suite offers a king size bed that may be split into two twins upon request. Ocean views from every room! Serene and private setting. Flexible living arrangements with 2/1.5 house & 1/1 cottage. Gourmet Kitchen. Big Patio, BBQ & Firepit.
 “Mermaid Crossing” is the perfect location to experience all that Monterey, California has to offer.  Mermaid Crossing was a labor of love, as the owners painstakingly updated and restored this 100 year-old historic beach cottage to be enjoyed for generations to come. Keep your eye out for otters basking out on the bay f
neighborhood_overview:
“Mermaid Crossing” is located on Mermaid Ave. the premier destination for those who want easy (walking or biking) access to all the conveniences and attractions but would rather enjoy the quiet serenity this zone provides. At Mermaid Crossing, you can park the car and forget about it. Walk out the front door and take 70 steps until your toes touch the water at famous Lover’s Point, a calm swimming beach during the summer that boasts great surfing during the winter months. Take in the jaw-dropping views of the entire Monterey Bay as you stroll along the Monterey Recreation trail to the front doors of the world renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium.
Great dining options abound the closest being the historic Beach House at Lover’s Point which has a full bar (open late) and gourmet seafood. Bringing your clubs? The Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Links is quite literally, in your backyard. Enjoy it’s stellar reputation as one of the “Nation’s Top 50 Gold Courses under $50.00” by Golf Digest.
host_about:
Rhonda is the managing broker of Pacific Grove Property Management. Their goal is to make your stay with them pleasurable enough to leave you longing to come back! They love where they live and can't wait to share it with you!  
CADRE# (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)

name: Forest Home on 1/4  Acre
description:
Cozy and spacious 1 bedroom, 1 bath cottage, w/bonus room, in beautiful Pacific Grove, CA. Accommodates 3 adults and 2+ children. Queen bed in bedroom, Pull-out queen sofa bed in living room, and day bed in bonus room. 10 min. walk to beautiful Asilomar Beach with white sand, gorgeous views, and amazing dog beach.Located between Monterey and Carmel on a large (1/4 acre) forested lot with a play set and fire pit. Just a few min. drive to the entrance gate of scenic, 17 Mile Drive. Pet friendly.

The space
Charming 1935 cottage located in the Coastal Zone of Pacific Grove. The cottage has a full size washer and dryer and fully equipped kitchen with a separate dining room. The kitchen has pots/pans, bake ware, dishes, silverware, coffee pot, microwave, toaster, and a hot/cold purified drinking water dispenser. There is a television in the living room and one in the bedroom. Both TVs have Rokus, which are already signed in to Netflicks and Hulu. Fireplace can be use
host_about: We fell in love with Pacific Grove while attending the annual Monterey Car week in 2015. We purchased two PG homes later that year, which we now operate as Airbnbs. We have just added our Huntington Harbor home as an AIRBNB rental.  All three homes are wonderful properties and we have many repeat guests.

neighborhood_overview:
The Monterey Peninsula is world-renown for its beauty! Enjoy the Monterey Aquarium, Fisherman’s Wharf and historic Cannery Row. Great golf, fine dining and plenty to see and do. Whatever your pleasure the Monterey Peninsula is the perfect vacation destination, and Pacific Grove is in the heart of it all.

Sharing borders with the City of Monterey, the Pacific Ocean, and the Del Monte Forest, Pacific Grove offers breathtaking views and recreational activities. The City provides services to the community including: excellent fire, emergency, and ocean rescue services; an award-winning natural history museum; the lowest crime rate of any city in Monterey County; a nationally-recognized 18-hole golf course; a monarch butterfly habitat sanctuary; sandy beaches; and, the oldest continuously-operating lighthouse on the west coast. "P.G." is known for its small-town hospitality and friendliness, so come experience it yourself!

We offer a seamless mix of friendly service, warm hospitality and comfortable rooms that make you feel right at home. Designed for romantic getaways, family vacations and business retreats, our unique hotel is the perfect place to work, unwind and play.

The space
Enjoy this spacious suite featuring 1 king bed with luxury bedding, sofa, coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave, separate living area, in-room Jacuzzi tub, fireplace, patio, work desk, flat screen TV, Dish Network w/ premium channels, free Wi-Fi and complimentary extended continental breakfast.

neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables.
A biking, running and hiking trail goes for miles along the oceanfront.
Lover's Point beach and quiet cove 2 blocks away.
Kayak and bike rentals most of year at Lover's Point.
Spectacular natural scenery.
Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.
Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff

name: Sallie’s Cottage
description: Wake up feeling inspired by the cheerful interior of this colorful home. The historic residence features beamed cathedral ceilings, eclectic furnishings and decor, contrasting textures and patterns throughout, a private yard, and a deck for dining.
neighborhood_overview: The house is very close to downtown and the beach, an easy walk in either direction. The neighborhood is full of quaint historic buildings, shops, and restaurants. There is plenty of on street, also off-street parking for one car in the driveway.
host_about:
I'm an architect, with with a background in design, land planning and historic preservation. I have a passion for nature, family, dogs, horses, travel and adventures.

My husband Tom is an ecologist, coastal biologist and park planner. Obviously, he is also a lover of nature!

Together Tom and I have painstakingly restored two historic houses in Pacific Grove... Including our 120 year old Airbnb cottage, which we started more than 30 years ago.

We've traveled the world together and separately, drawn to near and distant locations by friends,  culture, waves, and whimsy.

Airbnb hosting has allowed me to share the cottage that I love with people who enjoying it as I do. It is a genuine pleasure meeting the terrific people who visit on their adventures!

name: Sea Otter Sanctuary Cottage! Home share Lic. #0475
description:
Sea Otter Sanctuary (SOS) Cottage is a two bedroom, cozy home, one block from Lover's Point Beach and only two blocks from downtown Pacific Grove. One bedroom (queen) is available with a shared bathroom. The recreation trail is one block away and an easy walk or bike ride to Cannery Row and the Monterey Bay Aquarium. Also a beach front trail that leads to Point Pinos Lighthouse and Asilomar Beach. Off street parking fits a car, or van. I am vaccinated and ask that you are too!

The space
Sea Otter Sanctuary Cottage is a warm, artsy, home located in a central, convenient part of town! You are just an easy 2 block walk to downtown Pacific Grove, which hosts many fantastic restaurants, galleries, boutiques, and shops. SOS Cottage is also located blocks away from various beach and recreation trails that display the natural beauty of the Peninsula.

The cottage rental includes one bedroom, kitchen, dining area, living room and outdoor areas in the front and
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quaint, beachy neighborhood with a unique mix of home styles and little gardens to enjoy on your walk down to Lover's Point Beach. There are yummy places to eat lunch and dinner at the beach, or start the morning with a coffee and pastry just a block away! If you decide to walk up the two blocks to downtown P.G. you will have many options for dining, shopping and just enjoying the hometown vibe!
Lover's Point and the recreation trail are popular areas, depending on the weather and time of year, so there is foot traffic as the cottage living room is at the front of the cottage toward the sidewalk that goes to the beach. But for the most part the sounds of the neighborhood are happy people walking toward the bay and of course the sea gulls make themselves known daily!
Fortunately the property has off street parking so you never have to worry about finding a space to park!
host_about:
Hi there! am a native "Pagrovian" and teach in town. I feel so fortunate to have been raised in P.G., and then raise my three daughters here as well! I love sharing my cottage with Airbnb guests and have done so for the past few years. Big Sur is one of my favorite places in the world to spend time. I love sharing ideas of local places to visit and am happy to answer any questions! I truly believe that sand is NOT dirt! 
I am excited to share my childhood home with guests on the bay side of town! Thank you for checking out the Sea Otter Sanctuary Cottage! Happy planning and travels to you!

neighborhood_overview:
Please download our App to obtain our local recommendations and area attractions. Access to the App is automatically provided via email after your reservation is paid in full. You can share this app with all the guests in your party.
Please note that our Good Neighbor Policy is posted in our home and is strictly enforced.
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

neighborhood_overview:
We welcome you to experience the romance of the historic Pacific Grove Inn

The Pacific Grove Inn is a Historic Boutique Inn, that provides charming accommodations with the intimacy of a bed and breakfast. Built-in 1904 and 1908 by Sea Captain Frank LaVerne Buck and Apothecary Joseph Tuttle, these two establishments were remarkably sophisticated for their time and place in Pacific Grove on the Monterey Peninsula and are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

With only 16 hotel rooms and suites, Pacific Grove Inn blends an old world charm with modern day luxury including combinations of fireplaces, private porches, balconies, and entrance with views of the Monterey Bay.

A sanctuary of tranquility and charm awaken your senses with a continental breakfast, unwind in the evening with your fellow guests in the parlor.


Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capi

Pet Friendly and available for stays of 28 days or more 2018.This house was photographed for Carmel Magazine in Feb.09 for its Pacific Grove edition. an easy walk to many restaurants, coffee shops, antique shops,movie theater, farmers market, natural history museum, golf and the beach. Two blocks from Lover's Point Park, Caledonia park, beach and the coastal recreation trail where you can bike or rent surreys, kayaks and paddleboards. This small Cottage has One bedroom with French antique bed, down comforter, crystal chandelier and mirrored dresser ,kitchen has a functional antique wedgewood stove and Breville multi function oven, kitchen appliances and a sunny coffee spot or reading nook. neighborhood_overview: Ocean, rec trail, restaurants, shopping, museum, parks.
host_about:
I love living near the ocean here in Pacific Grove and walk daily with my dogs on the beach.I am a hair stylist and own a salon in Carmel, I own and renovate old houses and love to travel to tropical places. I enjoy walking to great restaurants and the  Farmer's market all within two blocks. This is the perfect location!
I hope your wanderings lead you to places you love.

name: Walking Distance to Beach and Monterey Bay
description:
Welcome to Pacific Gem in Pacific Grove

Conveniently located on Seventeen Mile Drive, Pacific Gem offers guests a two tenth of a mile walk to the beach, Esplanade Park and the Monterey Bay.

From the beach or Esplanade Park, guests may enjoy stunning views of the Pacific Ocean. On clear days, the Santa Cruz mountains beckon from across the vast Monterey Bay. Guest may enjoy watching the sea as yachts, sailboats, fishing boats and whale watching cruises pass by offshore. We have also seen whales breaching and spouting just offshore with the naked eye. And did we mention the spectacular Pacific Sunsets?

Our Pacific Gem is also located conveniently nearby the Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Course, also referred to as “The Public's Pebble Beach”. Your family’s golfer(‘s) can enjoy playing along the north shore of the Monterey Peninsula, or book a round at any of Pebble Beach’s five world class courses on the south and west shores.
neighborhood_overview:
Coast Estate invites you to experience the beautiful Monterey Peninsula and California Central Coast. The are is world renown for spectacular coastlines, unique coastal communities, and rich marine life. Coast Estate specializes in Luxury Vacation Rentals in Big Sur, Carmel, Carmel Highlands, Carmel Valley, Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Monterey and Seaside.

Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capital of California”, due to the annual migration of the Monarch butterflies. Pacific Grove is known for well kept Victorian homes and amazing seascapes along the scenic Sunset Drive.

Asilomar State Beach offers visitors beach and coast trail walks and a short, accessible boardwalk loop through the Asilomar Dunes Natural Preserve. The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continuously operating lighthouse on the West Coast and may be toured in the afternoon. 

Lovers Point Park has becom
host_about:
Our CEO, MaryJane was an executive with the Hyatt for seven years. She chose to leave the work force and stayed home to raise three boys! MaryJane fell into a job I loved, managing a Vacation Rental Company on the Monterey Peninsula and fell in LOVE with the idea of renting homes instead of Hotels. She left the company and started her own business to continue her passion for meeting people near and far and sharing the love of travel.

AirBnb had software problems, and had to recreate several of our listings,  under a second account.

You may see MaryJane's 149 Guest Reviews from the original Host Account.

This unit is a monthly rental. You must arrive by the second of the month, and depart within the same month. A Security Deposit will be collected by Sanctuary Vacation Rentals and used to pay the electricity, gas and water consumed prior to refunded the balance within 21 days of departure. Please refer to our House Rules for further information.850 sf, 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom vacation home sleeps up to 4 guests. 1 Queen, 1 King or 2 Twins. Dog OK. 1 car garage.

The space
Welcome to “Bungalow-by-the-Sea”! Sleeps 4

A meticulously restored Pacific Grove cottage offers peace, quiet and privacy in a tree-lined neighborhood that is within walking distance of parks, the Monterey Bay Recreation Trail, and downtown restaurants and attractions.

The 2-bedroom, 1-bath 850-square-foot home, built in 1923, has been remodeled to keep all of its historic charm while adding modern conveniences and a beautifully landscaped yard.

Among the many charm
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

The space

description:
1092 sf, 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom vacation home sleeps up to 6 guests. 2 Queens, 2 Twins. Dog OK. 1 car garage (small)

Welcome to “The Lavender House”! Sleeps 6

Park your car in the garage of this colorful Victorian, and walk to every Pacific Grove attraction from this ideal location right in the heart of town. Dining, shopping, the beach and the Monterey Recreational Trail are just steps away.

The space
Built in 1916, the home was recently renovated to offer modern conveniences along with vintage charm. Views of the Monterey Bay from its second and third floor bedrooms are fabulous and enhance the experience.

Exquisitely decorated with antique furniture and accessories, it’s like a trip to Pacific Grove’s past, from the old-fashioned front porch to the stained-glass windows.

The home is on a quiet lane, that runs parallel to the town’s main street. Close to Caledonia Park and three blocks from Lovers Point, it also has a

name: Charming Monterey Bay Home near the Beach
description:
One and a half blocks to the water's edge. Lover's Point and the nearest sandy beach are about 2 blocks further. One block to Lighthouse Ave and downtown where you will find many restaurants. Monterey Bay Aquarium is walkable, about 18 minutes on foot, 20 minutes by car. Pebble Beach, Carmel by the Sea, Monterey Fisherman's Wharf, Cannery Row are nearby, Big Sur is 50 minutes away. Decor is beachy, nautical theme. Safeway supermarket and Trader Joe's are about 8 minutes away by car.

Guest access
Guests may use the entire home and grounds except for the garage.

Other things to note
The 2nd floor has a balcony with a very limited view of the bay.
neighborhood_overview: One and half blocks to the oceanside. Lover's Point and the beach are about 4 blocks away, one block to Lighthouse Avenue, restaurants and downtown area, a movie theater is two blocks away, Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row are a 20 minute walk away. Fisherman's Wharf is a 10 minute drive. Big Sur is roughly a 50  minute drive. Many restaurants to choose from. Safeway supermarket is 8 minutes away as is Trader Joe's.

The AT&T Golf Pro-Am
Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance
Monterey Jazz Festival
Laguna Seca Sports Car Championship
Pebble Beach Food and Wine Festival
Pacific Grove Feast of Lanterns

name: 3788 Nightly Rental ~ Walk to Downtown and the Beach!
description:
1092 sf, 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom vacation home sleeps up to 6 guests. 2 Queens, 1 King or 2 Twins. Dog OK. No garage.

Welcome to “The Seagull’s Nest”! Home sleeps up to 6 guests.

**Please note there is construction work occurring during weekdays on an adjacent building.**

The best of past and present are combined in this historic Victorian cottage in downtown Pacific Grove, within easy walking distance of the beach as well as dining, shopping and the local movie theater.

The space
Or you may just want to relax and enjoy views of the bay from the cozy living room, decorated to reflect the coastal environment.

The blue and white 3-bedroom, 2-bath residence, built in 1905, has been updated to offer modern conveniences while still embracing its vintage roots. The pet-friendly home also has a back patio that is fenced for privacy, a perfect place to enjoy a backyard barbecue or a glass of wine in the evenings.

The
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: Historic Victorian Cottage Steps to Ocean!
description:
* Available for monthlong stays. Please message me with desired dates and availability/booking questions*

Charming Queen Anne Victorian steps from the Bay. One of the closest homes to the white sand beaches at Lovers Point & blocks from downtown Pacific Grove. The Aquarium is less than a mile down the trail. This cottage, built in 1892, exudes charm with original redwood floors, stained glass and ornate carved detail. A light, airy beach house, modernized for a relaxing getaway!

The space
*Breathtaking views of Monterey Bay
*Steps from the Ocean
*Steps from the coastal trail
*Bike, kayak, surrey rental at the end of our street
*Ocean views from 3 bedrooms
*Gas Grill on the back patio off the kitchen
*Pack and Play and high chair available
*Outdoor shower
*Very strict no pet policy

There is no driveway or garage at this property; parking is available on the street. Guests are encouraged to bring a max
neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove has dozens of great restaurants, coffee shops, and wine bars—most within a short walk of the house. Lover's Point Beach is steps away, for renting bikes, kayaks and paddling with the harbor seals and sea otters. The recreation trail on the coast is just a few steps away and will take you to all of the sites. Pacific Grove is a great walking and biking town.

Downtown:

* PG Juice and Java for coffee

*There is a Mexican restaurant, ‘Peppers’ 2 blocks up our street that is awesome, a Thai place 4 blocks away on Lighthouse, Pacific Thai Cuisine, (Go up to lighthouse, turn right and it is 2 blocks across the street) that is great.

*Michaels has the best Mexican take out, IL Vecchio on Central Ave is hands down the best Italian Restaurant in town (dine outside or takeout- huge portions and GREAT Cannoli!), Zum Sushi on Central is awesome for takeout as well.

*Asilomar beach for boogie boarding and amazing sunsets!

neighborhood_overview:
We welcome you to experience the romance of the historic Pacific Grove Inn

The Pacific Grove Inn is a Historic Boutique Inn, that provides charming accommodations with the intimacy of a bed and breakfast. Built-in 1904 and 1908 by Sea Captain Frank LaVerne Buck and Apothecary Joseph Tuttle, these two establishments were remarkably sophisticated for their time and place in Pacific Grove on the Monterey Peninsula and are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

With only 16 hotel rooms and suites, Pacific Grove Inn blends an old world charm with modern day luxury including combinations of fireplaces, private porches, balconies, and entrance with views of the Monterey Bay.

A sanctuary of tranquility and charm awaken your senses with a continental breakfast, unwind in the evening with your fellow guests in the parlor.

name: Private Stand-alone Cottages near Ocean & Beach
description:
A stroll, a kiss, a feeling, a sound, a sunset shared.

Retreat to the Pacific coast and experience a breath of fresh ocean air at this quaint Victorian boutique Inn. Centrella Inn has been a peaceful, romantic retreat destination of choice for charm and romance since 1889.

Ideally located: 2 minute walk to Lover’s Point & beach. 15 minutes walk to world-famous Monterey Bay Aquarium and historic Cannery Row. Close to Pebble Beach, Carmel and Big Sur.

Select Cottages are Pet friendly.

The space
These are individual cottages around a Victorian garden with a Master bedroom and a separate living room.

They have fireplaces, wet bar, mini fridge, clawfoot tub bath, TV, dining table and a sofa-bed.

The Cottages can accomodate families with children. The Cottages are ideal choice for guests seeking privacy in a cozy and intimate setting for a quiet retreat.

Rates are based on double occupancy. $40 per
neighborhood_overview:
Ideal location in a peaceful & charming neighborhood.

- 1 block from Pacific Grove downtown with many romantic restaurant, wine tasting rooms, cafes and boutique shops.

- 2 minute walk to Lover's Point Beach (one of the most popular beaches on the Monterey Peninsula) and coastal recreational trails.

- 10 minutes walk along the coastal recreational trail to the world-renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row.

- 5 minutes drive to Pebble Beach & 17-Mile Drive.

- Short drive to Carmel by the Sea and world famous Highway 1 to Big Sur.

name: Lovely Forest Home on One Acre in Pacific Grove
description:
Clean and spacious 2 bedroom, 2 bath home in beautiful Pacific Grove, CA. Accommodates 4 adults and 2+ children. Queen bed in master bedroom, Full bed in second bedroom, Pull-out queen sofa bed in living room. 10 min. walk to beautiful Asilomar Beach with white sand, gorgeous views, and amazing dog beach. Located between Monterey and Carmel on a large (1 acre) forested lot with fire pit and outdoor dining. Just a few min. drive to the entrance gate of scenic, 17 Mile Drive. Pet friendly.

The space
This ultra clean home is turn-key ready for your stay. It is fully stocked with everything that you will need for cooking, towels and bedding, and bathroom convenience items. It is truly a home away from home on a gorgeous 1 acre forest lot. It has excellent cable and wifi services, a very large and comfortable living room with lots of seating, updated features and designer touches and television in the bedrooms and living room. Outside is a dining patio with a barbequ
neighborhood_overview: The house is set back from the road and is very quiet and peaceful.  There are nature trails and walks nearby, including the beautiful coastal path along Oceanview Ave. It is a short five minute drive to the restaurants and shops at Cannery Row, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, and another few minutes from there to the Monterey Wharf.  It is close to all of the attractions on the Monterey Peninsula, yet tucked into a sleepy forest neighborhood. At night you can sit at the firepit and stargaze while listening to the ocean waves washing ashore. It is truly amazing!
host_about: We fell in love with Pacific Grove while attending the annual Monterey Car week in 2015. We purchased two PG homes later that year, which we now operate as Airbnbs. We have just added our Huntington Harbor home as an AIRBNB rental.  All three homes are wonderful properties and we have many repeat guests.

name: Spectacular Views - Walk to Cannery Row and the Aquarium
description:
Welcome to Monterey's Bay Views!

Due to City of Monterey Ordnance, all leases require a 31-night minimum.

Bay Views is a contemporary four (4) bedroom, two (2) bath home. Upon arriving, Guests are treated to panoramic views of the Monterey Bay. You may see the expansive Monterey Bay views throughout the house and soak up sun plus the best of the views on a private deck.

A convenient location puts you close to everything! The Monterey Bay Aquarium is just down the street, while a convenience store, grocery store, pizzeria, and the famous Cannery Row shops and restaurants are all walking distance from your rental.

Whale watching tours, the world renown golf courses of Pebble Beach, sandy beaches, oceanside walks and the Monterey- Pacific Grove Recreation path are all within minutes.

Natural light and bay views await in a fantastic entertaining space on the main floor. Updated furnishings and appliances include a c
neighborhood_overview:
The Monterey Peninsula is different than any other part of California. Here, time slows, the architecture is humble (with the exception of the homes in Pebble Beach), and the lifestyle is the perfect synthesis of SoCal laid back and NorCal sophisticated. On the northern side of the peninsula, the town of Monterey draws most of the tourists, while farther south, Carmel-by-the-Sea lures the easygoing wealthy set. Tremendous price tags on real estate helps maintain the small-community atmosphere along Monterey's jaw-dropping coastline.

This area makes for a tremendous road-trip stop or romantic weekend stay. And did we mention the golf courses? This stretch of the California coastline boasts some of the most coveted fairways in the world. Add to than an abundance of natural wonders, luxury resorts and seafood restaurants, and Monterey might just be the ideal destination for your next getaway.
host_about:
Our CEO, MaryJane was an executive with the Hyatt for seven years. She chose to leave the work force and stayed home to raise three boys! MaryJane fell into a job I loved, managing a Vacation Rental Company on the Monterey Peninsula and fell in LOVE with the idea of renting homes instead of Hotels. She left the company and started her own business to continue her passion for meeting people near and far and sharing the love of travel.

AirBnb had software problems, and had to recreate several of our listings,  under a second account.

You may see MaryJane's 149 Guest Reviews from the original Host Account.

Welcome to Hillcrest!



This updated Pacific Grove home shows pride of ownership and lots of extras! There is room for everyone in this 4 bed, 2.5 bath home with over 2067 square feet of living space.

Hillcrest features an open kitchen, living room and dining area that bask in the sunshine and welcome you to this very special home.

Enjoy indoor/outdoor living on the multiple deck areas that open to the family room, living room and bedrooms.

The updated kitchen, remodeled bath, new flooring are just a few recent upgrades! Close to Pacific Grove's  downtown stores and resturaunts.

Your hosts have provided the services of Carmel Coast Estate, Inc a locally owned and operated full service Real Estate and Property Management company. Your Property Managers are available by cellular phone, text messaging and email during your visit.

Here at Carmel Coast Estate, we take every measure to ensu
neighborhood_overview:
Coast Estate invites you to experience the beautiful Monterey Peninsula and California Central Coast. The are is world renown for spectacular coastlines, unique coastal communities, and rich marine life. Coast Estate specializes in Luxury Vacation Rentals in Big Sur, Carmel, Carmel Highlands, Carmel Valley, Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Monterey and Seaside.

Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capital of California”, due to the annual migration of the Monarch butterflies. Pacific Grove is known for well kept Victorian homes and amazing seascapes along the scenic Sunset Drive.

Asilomar State Beach offers visitors beach and coast trail walks and a short, accessible boardwalk loop through the Asilomar Dunes Natural Preserve. The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continuously operating lighthouse on the West Coast and may be toured in the afternoon.

name: Seagull House with views from Sunrise to Sunset
description:
We offer serenity above Monterey Bay. Enjoy the peace, quiet and views of our Penthouse three stories above downtown Pacific Grove. Views from sunrise to sunset. Walk to Lovers Point beach four blocks down the hill past the Monday farmers market. Private entry with elevator and serene contemporary decor. We call our space Seagull house on Grand and hope you create memories to last a lifetime.

The space
Our flat is the perfect solution for luxury and peace. Pacific Grove STR licence #0438. Our third story respite rivals our local high end hotel suites with the added benefit of privacy, views, kitchen and guest room. Park your car a block away in the 24 hour lot and walk to the beach, coastal trails and everything downtown Pacific Grove has to offer.

Guest access
You will have access to your flat through a shared entry room and elevator with our tenants who live on the second floor. There is a code on the door of this unit to insure privacy.
neighborhood_overview: We are nearly in the center of downtown Pacific Grove. Our street leads directly down to Lovers Point Beach and the walking/bike coastal trail along our beautiful peninsula. A block away enjoy restaurants, shops and art. The grocery store, Grove Market is a block away as well as our famous Pavel's bakery. Go early on Saturday as the line is out the door and up the street. We have a fantastic Barber shop, art supply store, vinyl record shop and historical museum. The Monterey Bay Aquarium is a 20 minute walk along the ocean and historic Cannery Row and The Wharf are all in walking distance. We love our location and hope you will too.
host_about: Coastal Californian. Lover of travel, design, art, music, film, garden, food and many other forms of creativity. We design and build for a living in Pacific Grove between Monterey and Carmel. Weekends are spent hiking in Big Sur or Marin, exploring San Francisco, surfing in Santa Cruz and annual trips to the Sawtooth mountains in Idaho to ride Peruvian Paso's with family friends. Hard work pays off.

description:

Welcome to “Little House”! Sleeps 6

A sweet Victorian home in Pacific Grove, just steps from the beach and the Monterey Bay Recreation Trail, is the perfect place to bring your family to relax and unwind, close enough to hear the waves and hear the seagulls calling in the distance.

The space
The Little House, built in 1888, is a registered Pacific Grove Historic Home and has vintage charm inside and out while also offering modern conveniences. Pet-friendly with a fenced back yard, it’s set up for every member of the family.

The 3-bedroom, 2-bath home features stained glass windows and other classic Victorian details, as well as original hardwood floors and light fixtures, lovely antique furniture, historic photographs and other vintage details.

Besides being just steps from the beach, the 1,400-squ
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: Seal Rocks Room - Seven Gables Inn
description:
The extremely popular Seal Rocks Room is decorated in rose, green, and cream. Lay in bed and enjoy and outstanding view of Monterey Bay and Lover's Point Beach through a twelve-foot-wide picture window. The full bathroom has tub/shower combination in tan and rose marble.

*Rooms are sanitized following the Clean+Safe protocol outlined by Calif Lodging Assoc. Due to COVID-19 there is NO interim maid service.
*Complimentary breakfast
* Lots of restaurants very close to Inn.

The space
*Beautifully furnished with modern amenities.
*Complimentary breakfast
*Free WiFi
*Free On-street parking
*Actual photos of room and view as well as Lobby and surrounding area.

Guest access
Access to room 24 hours a day.
Guests have full access to main Lobby area from 9am-7pm.
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables, a biking and hiking trail running for miles along the oceanfront and spectacular natural scenery.  Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.  Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff 

Note: This information was updated on August 13th 2021

name: Three Mermaid’s Cove Modern Penthouse at the Beach
description:
Three Mermaid’s Cove is located on the desirable Mermaid Avenue in Pacific Grove. This modern Penthouse provides views of the ocean and is just steps away from Ocean View Boulevard’s majestic ocean front. Take a walk down to the end of the street to Lover's Point Beach or take a stroll a few blocks up to town and enjoy a multitude of wonderful restaurants, great coffee, and PG’s quaint neighborhood. Experience PG like a local! Only a short distance to the Aquarium, Monterey, and Carmel.

The space
Three Mermaid's Cove is a stylish Penthouse in a Triplex. Upon entering the common area shared with the downstairs unit there are 15 steps leading to the entry of the Penthouse. Upon entry, you are greeted with floor to ceiling windows with peaks of the bay. Enjoy the view from the living room, gourmet kitchen, and balcony. The balcony is the perfect place to enjoy an outdoor meal or take in the morning sunshine with a cup of tea while listening to the symphony of t
neighborhood_overview:
“Mermaid Crossing” is located on Mermaid Ave. the premier destination for those who want easy (walking or biking) access to all the conveniences and attractions but would rather enjoy the quiet serenity this zone provides. At Mermaid Crossing, you can park the car and forget about it. Walk out the front door and take 70 steps until your toes touch the water at famous Lover’s Point, a calm swimming beach during the summer that boasts great surfing during the winter months. Take in the jaw-dropping views of the entire Monterey Bay as you stroll along the Monterey Recreation trail to the front doors of the world renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium.
Great dining options abound the closest being the historic Beach House at Lover’s Point which has a full bar (open late) and gourmet seafood. Bringing your clubs? The Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Links is quite literally, in your backyard. Enjoy it’s stellar reputation as one of the “Nation’s Top 50 Gold Courses under $50.00” by Golf Digest. O
host_about:
Rhonda is the managing broker of Pacific Grove Property Management. Their goal is to make your stay with them pleasurable enough to leave you longing to come back! They love where they live and can't wait to share it with you!

1000 sf, 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom vacation home sleeps up to 4 guests. 2 Queens. Dog OK. No garage.

Welcome to “Surf’s Up”! Sleeps 4

Park your car, and walk everywhere from this pet and family-friendly cottage — where you can hear the cry of seagulls during the day and the murmur of waves at night — just steps away from spectacular Lovers Point, the beach, and restaurants and shopping in downtown Pacific Grove.

The space
The 2-bedroom, 1-bath newly painted historic home, known as the C.A. McCoy House and built in 1887, features large open rooms and a generously sized laundry room with plenty of space to stow beach gear. Tall ceilings and windows that let in plenty of natural light give this residence a spacious ambiance, with easy-care vinyl plank flooring that is perfect for pet owners.

Besides being just steps from the beach, the 985-square-foot home also offers easy access to attractions such as Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Links,

name: Endless Summer! Cheerful Updated Two- bedroom
description:
Perfect home base to enjoy the Peninsula with family. Located on a quiet one-way street, steps to beach, restaurants, close to Monterey Bay Aquarium. Stroll to Lover's Point and seaside bike paths. Charming, spacious, yet cozy with lots of natural light and classic 1930's architecture. Kitchen and bathroom just renovated and fully equipped. Dine while enjoying ocean views from the light and airy sunroom. Outdoor decks and garden get great sunlight. Safe, fully gated with private parking.

Less than a mile from the Monterey Bay Aquarium, coastal walking/ bike trails.

Large landscaped yard, outdoor dining on deck, walking distance to Lover’s Point sandy beach- swim, sunbathe or surf!

Apple TV in living room and master bedroom, beds are very comfortable with fresh linens, quality bedding, pillows, towels. Kitchen fully equipped with dishes, cutlery, microwave, gas oven etc.

If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

host_about:
I am a working professional in Silicon Valley with a passion for interior design and the hospitality industry. In early 2017, I joined Airbnb as a host and managed my first Airbnb property. Ever since then, I have never stopped creating more and more unique homes for my Airbnb guests. Up to this point, we are offering more than 13 properties in the Bay Area and California Coastal area. Each property has its unique interior design and furniture layout. But my goal for each property is to provide the most comfortable stays and amazing experience for all of my guests.  

When I travel, I always stay at Airbnb properties. I personally have very high expectations when staying away from home and I hope all my properties meet yours, knowing you are traveling away from your home. My team members include my partner, Carrie, a customer service crew, a cleaning crew and a repair / handyman crew. They are on call 7-days a week at your service. We strive to exceed expectations to all of our guests with the utmost respect and respond. We will ensure each property is thoroughly cleaned with enhanced cleaning protocols, and with fresh bed sheets, towels, and bath rugs upon your arrival. 

I hand picked all of the furniture, bed sheets and kitchen equipment for each of our properties. I want to make sure everything my guests use is high quality with a unique style to allow them fully enjoy the space, because my guests deserve the best!

I am also an active member of Airbnb.org which is a non-profit organization started by the founders of Airbnb. In a daily basis, I donate a certain percentage of my revenue from each guest's booking to Airbnb.org. Our mission is to unlock the power of sharing space, resources, and support in times of needs! We partner with the worldwide communities to open housing in emergencies in order to  provide shelters for people who lost their homes. 

Thank you! My team and I look forward to hosting you in the near future!

neighborhood_overview:
Coast Estate invites you to experience the beautiful Monterey Peninsula and California Central Coast. The are is world renown for spectacular coastlines, unique coastal communities, and rich marine life. Coast Estate specializes in Luxury Vacation Rentals in Big Sur, Carmel, Carmel Highlands, Carmel Valley, Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Monterey and Seaside.

Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capital of California”, due to the annual migration of the Monarch butterflies. Pacific Grove is known for well kept Victorian homes and amazing seascapes along the scenic Sunset Drive.

Asilomar State Beach offers visitors beach and coast trail walks and a short, accessible boardwalk loop through the Asilomar Dunes Natural Preserve. The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continuously operating lighthouse on the West Coast and may be toured in the afternoon.

host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping.

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff

name: La Piccola Casa Lic. #446
description:
Every house has a story but few are as iconic as La Piccola Casa. Built in early 1900, La Piccola has had a diverse journey. This lovely Victorian lady spent her early years as a Pacific Grove residence before becoming La Piccola Pizzeria & Coffee Shop in 2005. After years of serving thousands of guests, La Piccola has taken on a new life. Lovingly restored by restaurateurs, Joe & Laurie Rombi, she has returned to her roots as a residence while still retaining memories of her culinary past.

The space
La Piccola is an authentic Victorian with all of the modern conveniences and amenities any savvy traveler could want. This two bedroom, two bath cottage has pillow top queen beds, crisp white linens and fluffy bath towels along with individual toiletries. La Piccola comes complete with brand new washer/dryer, utility sink, hair dryers, USB plugs by every nightstand, reverse osmosis drinking water tap, cable television with 60" plasma TV, high speed WiFi and Sonos sys
host_about:

Upstairs you will find another bedr
neighborhood_overview:
The Monterey Peninsula is different than any other part of California. Here, time slows, the architecture is humble (with the exception of the homes in Pebble Beach), and the lifestyle is the perfect synthesis of SoCal laid back and NorCal sophisticated. On the northern side of the peninsula, the town of Monterey draws most of the tourists, while farther south, Carmel-by-the-Sea lures the easygoing wealthy set. Tremendous price tags on real estate helps maintain the small-community atmosphere along Monterey's jaw-dropping coastline.

This area makes for a tremendous road-trip stop or romantic weekend stay. And did we mention the golf courses? This stretch of the California coastline boasts some of the most coveted fairways in the world. Add to than an abundance of natural wonders, luxury resorts and seafood restaurants, and Monterey might just be the ideal destination for your next getaway.
